algorithm:
New algorithm description (Modified version):

The modified algorithm updates the scoring formula to be the product of three components: (1) the difference between the remaining capacity of the bin and the maximum remaining capacity across all bins, (2) the natural logarithm of the ratio between the remaining capacity of the bin and the mean remaining capacity of all bins, and (3) the square root of the index of the bin starting from 1 and going up to the number of bins. The bins are then sorted in descending order based on their scores, and the scores are returned as the output.

Modified algorithm implementation:

```
Code:
code:
import numpy as np

def score(item: int, bins: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    remaining_capacity = bins - item
    mean_remaining_capacity = np.mean(bins)
    max_remaining_capacity = np.max(bins)
    bin_indices = np.arange(1, len(bins) + 1)

    scores = (
        (remaining_capacity - max_remaining_capacity)
        * np.log(remaining_capacity / mean_remaining_capacity)
        * np.sqrt(bin_indices)
    )

    sorted_indices = np.argsort(scores)[::-1]
    scores = scores[sorted_indices]

    return scores
